title: Trend Micro Internet Security Toolbar for Firefox
content:
Hi,

I have been using Trend Micro Internet Security and Firefox as long as I can remember. Perhaps a year ago, the Trend toolbar no longer works with Firefox, but it does with Edge.

With the toolbar installed, all websites listed with a search inquiry, are flagged with a green tick if they are deemed safe, or with a question mark, or a red X if deemed unsafe.

Trend says they are working with Mozilla to sort out getting the toolbar back on Firefox but it's been a really long time.

In the meantime they said I should change my browser which I really do not want to do.

I'm contemplating cancelling my Trend subscription which will expire soon but I was wondering if other security programs have this feature and if they work with Firefox.

Thanks Hans

title: Firefox suddenly stops communicating with the internet while other browsers do fine
content:
I have this issue on multiple machines, Windows 10 Single Language. Randomly, Firefox stops accessing the internet. While everything else (including Chrome, Edge, Vivaldi...) works fine!

  • If a website needs internet connection, the function that does stops working.
  • If you try to open a new website - NOTHING happens. Not even a small bar at the bottom that should say first the webstie address, then "read..." "connected... " etc. The only thing that happens is that the firefox icon next to "New Tab" becomes an hourglass icon.

This persists for random time from 5 sec to 2 minutes. Then it clears up.

I see no way to debug this because I cannot use debugger, network profiler, anything, because nothing shows anything until the page starts loading, and when it's loading, it's showing normal numbers. So this "lag" of up to 2 minutes doesn't show up anywhere.

Firefox's network settings are default, as are other browsers's.

Other browsers and network apps work flawlessly when this happens. So this is clearly somehow Firefox's only issue, since EVERYTHING else keeps working, including calling, opening new pages, whatever.

Here is a screen recording with the bug: https://ufile.io/kdefyn1h
creator: starsabre

title: Mozilla Firefox keeps dropping my internet connection
content: I've had this problem for a while now, the time I try to play a video or any other media and share it on Discord or other application, my internet connection keeps dropping and it stays like that for about a minute (I tried to check it with my ping command to my router and it shows that internet completely dies with no response back). It only occurs with Firefox, it works perfectly fine with other browsers like Chrome or Vivaldi. It was fine a year ago, I didn't have this problem. I have ethernet connection, Win10 version 21H2.

title: How to show actual real link in hover bar
content:
Links that appear in a Facebook page appear like this: https:<etc>mypolice.page.link/d... But actually goes to: https:<etc>l.facebook.com<etc>l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmypolice.page.link%2Fd...

Fair enough. The link text doesn't have to be the same as the URL it's going to.

But the "hover" link that shows at the bottom of the screen is *extremely* misleading, because it doesn't show the real link - it doesn't show where it actually is going. If I right click a link and Copy Link, then I can see the real destination by pasting it in a text file.

How do I change the hover "status bar" text to show the actual, real destination of a link?
creator: PeterL777

creator: b0nd

title: Simplified Printing
content:
Hello. I know that simplified printing is not always available but I don't understand why it wouldn't be consistently available or unavailable when the pages of a site are ostensibly the same? e.g., my Data Science prof has a site she created with "chapters" and quizzes/exercises. I sometimes can print the quiz that I took and sometimes I cannot (in simplified view). They seem to be the same format. I've had this occur with other sites too, e.g., a site that offers recipes. The recipes seem to be presented the same way and show up the same when you go to print them.

What might be different among these pages that would prevent simplified printing from consistently being presented as an option? It becomes super frustrating to find a workaround to print something I need without it being 18 pages long--when in simplified view, it's only 2!

Thank you!

Lisa
creator: ldpmail

title: Thumbnails won't load on facebook + slow scroll
content:
I have noticed this mostly while browsing facebook, but can happen in more websites. I cannot recall which at the moment.

When ever I browse for more than a few minutes, and in the process also open new tabs of facebook (different groups and posts), after a while, images won't load (screenshot attached).

This can be fixed by exiting and relaunching the firefox browser. Or, it can be fixed by itself if I refresh some times, or maybe after a few minutes of me not browsing facebook.

I have tried disabling the ad-block software for the site, as well as disabling firefox enhanced tracking protection - and then refreshing. There was no change. Also, I use the Multi Firefox Account Container, and I tried opening facebook tab in "no container" but it will still open in the facebook container (I still see the colored line no top), so I am not sure if that can fix it.

Another issue I experience, is while scrolling - the more I scroll down and see more posts, the slower and more sluggish facebook gets. I do not remember this being an issue a while ago.

If you need more information, let me know
creator: sata67
